Class Player

java.lang.Object
org.example.galaxy_trucker.Model.Player
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class Player extends Object implements Serializable
Represents a player in the game, encapsulating their state, attributes, and actions. This class handles player-specific behaviors, such as managing tiles, cards, construction, and interactions with game board elements.
See Also:

  • Constructor Details

    • Player

      public Player()
      Default constructor for the Player class. Initializes the player state and associated properties to default values. The player is created in a non-ready state, without having acted, and with no current tile, player state, or card assigned. A new list is instantiated for the player's goods to handle.

  • Method Details

    • getFinishListener

      public FinishListener getFinishListener()
      Retrieves the finish listener associated with this instance.
      Returns:
      the FinishListener instance that is currently set

    • setFinishListener

      Sets the finish listener that will be triggered when the associated event or process is completed.
      Parameters:

      the ReadyListener instance currently set.

      Sets the listener that gets notified when the component is ready.
      Parameters:
      readyListener - the ReadyListener to be notified when the component is ready

      public GameBoard getCommonBoard()
      Retrieves the common game board instance.
      Returns:
      the shared GameBoard instance used across the application

    • setPhaseListener

      public void setPhaseListener(PhaseListener phaseListener)
      Sets the PhaseListener for the current instance.
      Parameters:
      phaseListener - the PhaseListener to be set

    • getCurrentTile

      public Tile getCurrentTile()
      Retrieves the current tile.
      Returns:
      the current Tile object representing the position or state.

    • setCurrentTile

      public void setCurrentTile(Tile currentTile)
      Sets the current tile to the specified tile. If there is already a tile set, an IllegalStateException is thrown to indicate that the operation cannot be performed.
      Parameters:
      currentTile - the tile to be set as the current tile. Must be null to avoid exception.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if a tile is already set.

    • RollDice

      public int RollDice()
      rolls 2 dice
      Returns:
      the dice result (int between 2-12)

    • getPlayerState

      public PlayerState getPlayerState()
      Retrieves the current state of the player.
      Returns:
      the current PlayerState object representing the player's current

    • setState

      public void setState(PlayerState state)
      Updates the current player state and triggers appropriate actions based on the new state. If a phase listener is set, it notifies the listener about the phase change. The state also determines whether the player is required to act.
      Parameters:
      state - The new PlayerState

    • setMyPlance

      public void setMyPlance(PlayerBoard myPlance)
      Sets the player's specific board configuration.
      Parameters:
      myPlance - the PlayerBoard to be set for the player

    • execute

      public void execute()
      Executes the action associated with the player's current card. This method activates the card assigned to the player, performing the behavior defined within the card's implementation. The method depends on the `CurrentCard` being initialized and non-null. If the current card is not set or initialized, this method might result in a runtime exception or undesired behavior.

    • StartTimer

      public void StartTimer() throws RuntimeException
      Starts the timer for the player by invoking the hourglass functionality through the CommonBoard. This method is typically called during phases where time tracking is required for the player's actions.
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if the hourglass operation fails or if the player has not prepared their ship as required.

    • PickNewTile

      public void PickNewTile(int index)
      Picks a new tile based on the provided index. If no tile is currently picked, either a new random tile or a tile at the specified index is retrieved depending on the input value.
      Parameters:
      index - the index of the tile to be picked. If index is -1, a random tile is picked. If the index is a non-negative number, a tile at the specified index is picked. If the index is invalid, an exception is thrown.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if a tile is already picked and the method is called again.
      InvalidInput - if the index is other than -1 or non-negative.

    • DiscardTile

      public void DiscardTile() throws RemoteException, com.fasterxml.jackson.core.JsonProcessingException
      Discards the current tile held by the player, if it is allowed to be discarded. This method performs the following steps: 1. Checks if the player currently holds a tile. If not, an IllegalStateException is thrown. 2. Verifies if the current tile has not been marked as chosen. If the tile is chosen, an IllegalStateException is thrown to prevent it from being discarded. 3. Adds the current tile to the collection of uncovered tiles on the Common Board. 4. Sets the CurrentTile to null, signifying that the player no longer holds a tile. 5. Notifies listeners that the player's hand has changed by triggering a HandEvent.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the player attempts to discard a tile when no tile is held, or if the tile is marked as chosen.
      RemoteException - if there is an issue during remote communication.
      com.fasterxml.jackson.core.JsonProcessingException - if there is an error in JSON processing during the operation.

    • PlaceInBuffer

      public void PlaceInBuffer()
      places the current tile in the buffer

    • SelectFromBuffer

      public void SelectFromBuffer(int index)
      takes a tile from the buffer
      Parameters:
      index - of the tile to pick

    • setCard

      public void setCard(Card NewCard)
      Updates the player's current card to the specified new card. If a card listener is set, it triggers a notification with the new card's details.
      Parameters:
      NewCard - The new Card to be assigned to the player.

    • EndConstruction

      public void EndConstruction() throws IllegalStateException
      Finalizes the construction process for the current game state. This method sets up the starting position by invoking the necessary procedures from the CommonBoard class.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the method is invoked in an invalid game state (e.g., attempting to use a level 1 command in a level 2 game).

    • EndConstruction

      public void EndConstruction(int index) throws IllegalStateException, IllegalArgumentException
      Finalizes the player's construction phase and sets their starting position on the common game board. This method ensures that the game state and level are appropriate for this action.
      Parameters:
      index - The index of the starting position to assign to the player.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the game is not at level 2, as this action is only permitted in level 2 games.
      IllegalArgumentException - if the specified index is out of bounds or the position is already taken.

    • CalculateResult

      public int CalculateResult(boolean finished)
      Calculates the result for a player based on their completion status in the game. If the race is finished, additional bonuses are added to the result.
      Parameters:
      finished - A boolean indicating whether the race has been completed by the player. True if the race is finished, false otherwise.
      Returns:
      The total result of the player, including bonuses if applicable.

    • finishRace

      public int finishRace(int result, String message)
      Completes the race for a player and determines the end-game state. If the result is greater than 0, the player is considered successful; otherwise, unsuccessful. Invokes the finishListener's `onEndGame` method to handle the end of the game.
      Parameters:
      result - an integer representing the player's performance or score in the race
      message - a string containing a descriptive message for the end-of-game status
      Returns:
      the final result of the race as an integer

    • finishRace

      public int finishRace(ScoreboardEvent scoreboardEvent, int result, String message)
      Ends the race and notifies the finish listener with the appropriate result and message.
      Parameters:
      scoreboardEvent - an instance of ScoreboardEvent containing details about the race.
      result - an integer indicating the outcome of the race, where a positive value signifies success.
      message - a string containing a message to be passed to the finish listener.
      Returns:
      the result of the race as an integer.

    • SetReady

      public void SetReady(boolean ready)
      Updates the player's ready status and triggers the associated ready listener. This method sets the player's "ready" state to the provided value and notifies the ready listener to handle readiness-related actions.
      Parameters:
      ready - a boolean indicating the player's readiness status. True if the player is ready, false otherwise.

    • SetHasActed

      public void SetHasActed(boolean hasActed)
      Updates the player's action state.
      Parameters:
      hasActed - A boolean indicating whether the player has performed an action. True if the player has acted, false otherwise.

    • setId

      public void setId(String id)
      Sets the ID of the player.
      Parameters:
      id - the unique identifier to be assigned to the player

    • setBoards

      public void setBoards(GameBoard CommonBoard)
      Sets the common game board for the player and initializes the player's individual board based on the level of the provided common board.
      Parameters:
      CommonBoard - the GameBoard object representing the common game board to be set for the player

    • GetID

      public String GetID()
      Retrieves the unique identifier (ID) of the player.
      Returns:
      the player's ID as a String

    • GetReady

      public boolean GetReady()
      Retrieves the player's readiness status.
      Returns:
      true if the player is ready, false otherwise.

    • GetHasActed

      public boolean GetHasActed()
      Retrieves the player's action status indicating whether the player has performed an action.
      Returns:
      true if the player has acted, false otherwise

    • getmyPlayerBoard

      public PlayerBoard getmyPlayerBoard()
      Retrieves the player's individual board configuration.
      Returns:
      the PlayerBoard object representing the player's specific board setup

    • getCurrentCard

      public Card getCurrentCard()
      Retrieves the player's current card.
      Returns:
      the current Card object assigned to the player, or null if no card is assigned.

    • setHandListener

      public void setHandListener(HandListener handListener)
      Sets the hand listener for the player. This listener is responsible for responding to changes or updates related to hand events. The specified listener will handle actions triggered by hand events associated with the player.
      Parameters:
      handListener - the HandListener instance to be assigned to the player. This listener will be notified of hand-related changes or events.

    • removeHandListener

      public void removeHandListener()
      Removes the hand listener associated with the player. This method sets the player's hand listener reference to null, effectively detaching any previously set hand listener.

    • setCardListner

      public void setCardListner(CardListner cardListner)
      Sets the card listener for the player. The card listener is responsible for handling events related to card operations, such as new card notifications or deck updates.
      Parameters:
      cardListner - the CardListner implementation to be set for the player. This listener will handle card-related events.

    • removeCardListener

      public void removeCardListener()
      Removes the card listener associated with the player. This method sets the `cardListner` field to `null`, effectively disabling any notifications or functionality tied to the card listener. It is typically used to clean up resources or reset the card listener when it is no longer needed.

    • removeReadyListener

      public void removeReadyListener()
      Removes the ready listener associated with the player. This method sets the `readyListener` field to null, effectively detaching any previously set listener for handling readiness-related actions.

    • removeFinishListener

      public void removeFinishListener()
      Removes the finish listener associated with the player. This method sets the `finishListener` field to null, effectively disabling any finish-related event callbacks.

    • isDebugCalled

      public boolean isDebugCalled()
      Checks whether debug mode has been called.
      Returns:
      true if debug mode was invoked, false otherwise.

    • setDebugCalled

      public void setDebugCalled(boolean debugCalled)
      Sets the debugCalled flag to the specified value.
      Parameters:
      debugCalled - the value to set for the debugCalled flag
